page.title: 03TRANSPORTATION
page.content: The valley has been an important route- way for at least 2000 years.The A41 is a road link between London and Holyhead . Commuter and heavy goods traffic exert a great deal of pressure on this narrow road between 0700hrs and 1900hrs. The road is equally busy at the weekend with day trippers visiting the countryside. There are bus links between Berkhamsted, London, Watford, Hemel Hempstead, Windsor, Tring and Aylesbury. HGV traffic is both national and international. A high amount of passenger and freight rail traffic travels through the valley between destinations such as London, Birmingham and Glasgow. The line is electrified and the latest APT units are used for long distance work and DMU are used for commuters to London.
